title: Software Subscriptions & Licenses

sections.title: Professional Subscriptions
sections.content:
Many professional tools use a subscription model (SaaS - Software as a Service).

- **Subscription**: A regular payment for a service (Microsoft 365, Zoom, Adobe).
- **Monthly Fee**: The price the company pays every month per user.
- **Annual / Yearly Fee**: The price paid once a year (often cheaper).
- **Free Trial**: Using a software for free for a short time to test it.
- **License**: The official permission to use a software.

sections.title: Automatic Billing & Renewals
sections.content:
Companies often set up automatic payments for their digital tools.

- **Auto-Pay**: The system pays the invoice automatically on a specific day.
- **Billing Date**: The day the company is charged for the service.
- **Renewal**: When a subscription continues for another period (month/year).
- **Cancel**: To stop the subscription before the next billing date.

sections.title: Subscription Cycle
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Start Free Trial] --> B[Trial Ends]
    B --> C{Renew?}
    C -- Yes --> D[First Auto-Pay]
    D --> E[Active License]
    E --> F[Next Billing Date]
    C -- No --> G[Service Stops]
```

objectives: Identify common professional subscription terms (Monthly, Annual, License)
Understand how 'Auto-Pay' works for software invoices
Learn basic phrases for renewing or cancelling a professional service

keyTerms.definition: Software as a Service; paying for software on a subscription basis.
The legal right to use a specific software or tool.
The process of extending a subscription for another period.
